com.ai

Class VM

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ai.VM

  • public class VM
extends java.lang.Object
    This Class holds all of the variables created during traversal of a monsters script. Fields created during execution of a script are stored in _internals. Scripts access outside State fields from _externals.

    For scripts can access a finite amount of specific information about the gameState. This information is stored in _externals. _externals is created immediately before running of a script by loadPCs(State, String) and #loadSelf(Monster).Scripts cannot change information inside _externals. They can only access it.

    Author:
    Martin Tice

      Initializes data Structures for holding external and internal data.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the monster about to run script Sets _self.

      • setExternal

        public void setExternal(java.lang.String key,
               ASTCell value)
        Puts an entry in _externals. Scripts do not have access to this method and therefore cannot change state fields.
        Parameters:
        key - String to be used for a key in _externals.
        value - ASTCell to be used as a value in _externals.

      • getExternal

        public ASTCell getExternal(java.lang.String key)
        getter for _externals
        Parameters:
        key - String key to try and match in _externals.
        Returns:
        an ASTCell value in _externals from given key String

      • clearData

        public void clearData()
        Used to clear all data between monster strategy executions. Clears: _internals, _externals, _playerLocations, _players, _distancesPlayers, _inRange.

      • setInternal

        public void setInternal(java.lang.String key,
               ASTCell value)
        Setter for _internals This sets a mapping between a string name and its data when created during execution of the syntax tree.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of a variable. Of type String
        value - the variables value. Of type ASTCell

      • getCell

        public ASTCell getCell(java.lang.String key)
        Getter for _internals.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the key. Of type String
        Returns:
        the value associated with the input key. Of Type ASTCell

      • containsVar

        public boolean containsVar(ASTCell c)
        Determines if a key-value pairing exist in _internals. For use when re-assigning script specific fields.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the variable. Of type String
        Returns:
        true if field exists, false otherwise

      • inRange

        public boolean inRange()
        Used for determining if there are any PC's in range of attack. Determined by size of _inRange.
        Returns:
        true if _inRange.size() is > 0. false otherwise.

      • loadState

        public void loadState(State s)
        loads a State object to _gs
        Parameters:

      • loadPCs

        public void loadPCs(State s,
           java.lang.String mapName)
        Loads all players location into VM. Gets a list of players from State.getLivingPlayers()

        adds each player to _players

        adds each player location to _playerLocations

        Parameters:
        s - the current game state, a State object

      • loadSelf

        public void loadSelf(GameCharacter scriptable)
        Does the following with a given non-player character:

        loads its info under "self.*" into _externals

        calculates all distances between other players and itself

        loads closest.* furthest.* and random.* attributes into _externals

        loads the _spellList of current monster. loads any other necessary attributes necessary for calculation of strategy

        Parameters:
        monster -

      • parseAction

        public void parseAction(java.lang.String command,
               java.lang.String target)
        Called by an ActionASTCell. This sets all the information needed to perform a desired command.

        sets the following:

        • _targetName, _targetTile, _targetX, _targetY
        • _self, #_selfName, _selfTile, #_selftX, _selfY
        • _command
        Parameters:
        command - the decided command number
        target - the name of the target pc.

      • getCommand

        public ComparableCommand getCommand()

        Returns the final command decided from a strategy. Commands are decided by the string value of _command As Monster scripts require more commands, more commands will be able to be returned.Each command is returned in the following fashion:

        if(command.equals(eachCommand)){

        make any required calculations with values created by parseAction(String, String)

        return command }
        Returns:

      • getPlayerCount

        public int getPlayerCount()
        Get's the number of players.
        Returns:
        the number of players in the game.
